bioghist.p: Francis Campbell Macaulay built an extraordinary collection of early editions of Dante, Petrarch, Boccaccio, and Tasso, which he bequeathed to the University of Pennsylvania in 1896.

scopecontent.p: This is an autograph collection compiled by Francis Campbell Macauley. The collection is composed of letters by scientists, politicians, and men of letters, and fragments with signatures. The collection reflects Macauley's interest in Italian literature, and includes letters from Lodovico Ariosto, Fortunato Cavazzeni Pederzini, and Allessandro Torri. Other notable names in the collection are Alexandre Dumas, Robert Morris, and Millard Fillmore. The collection also includes several letters to Macauley regarding the Dante Society, The collection also includes five volumes of Macauley's notes for a vocabulary of the dialect of Nice.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
